channel.title: Convenience
channel.description:
Have you all ever realised how much we pay for convenience? For example, at my school they sell Hot Pockets in the lobby for $1.75 each. For a box of 12, it's like 5-6 dollars. So if you go to a store and buy a box, each one costs between $0.42 and $0.50. But instead of going to the store, and getting a box for $6, with enough for about 2 weeks (one for breakfast every morning), they would rather pay the $1.75 because they don't have to go anywhere.
I don't know, just something I noticed.

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I hate Wal-Mart for destroying all the small stores ( Kroger does the same thing really), but can’t argue with the cheap prices.

Read full topic

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:50, topic:390508”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=486420.msg3565749#msg3565749 date=1302638952]

yeah talking economics here. The reason it cost’s much more in Cafes and Schools etc etc. is because you pay alot of VAT (value added tax). In supermarkets, stores you don’t pay as much VAT on your goods, because they brought it in bulk which costs far less to begin with, therefore they can afford to sell it cheaper. Schools and cafes don’t buy things in bulk which is much more expensive, therefore they have to make things a little more pricey to make up the lost profit.
As for runescape economics, i have no idea. L2P i guess.

What are you talking about? They charge more because we have no choice…

Retail mangement over MITB Geek sorry, JC im right your wrong. GOI
[/quote]
Now this made me laugh. A hotpocket isn’t going to cost $1.20 more because they aren’t buying them in bulk. It’s simply because they are reaping the profit to the fullest capabilities. They know the kids won’t buy hotpockets and bring them in, so why not raise a few dollars for the school in the process?

Yes, you do have a point though. The reason that Wal-Mart has such low prices is because they buy say 20 million cans of Monster for usually 60 cents. They can tell the company that produces Monster to sell the cans to them for 50 cents a can instead. Monster really has no choice, because they will still be making money and also selling 20 million cans. That is how Wal-Mart puts all of the little, family-owned businesses out of business. [/quote]

And then the happy stay-at-home-mothers with the hard-working husband and the two adorable children (one boy, one girl) living in their own nice little house in the suburbs becomes sad.

Read full topic

In supermarkets, stores you don’t pay as much VAT on your goods, because they brought it in bulk which costs far less to begin with, therefore they can afford to sell it cheaper. Schools and cafes don’t buy things in bulk which is much more expensive, therefore they have to make things a little more pricey to make up the lost profit.
As for runescape economics, i have no idea. L2P i guess.

What are you talking about? They charge more because we have no choice…
[/quote]

Retail mangement over MITB Geek sorry, JC im right your wrong. GOI[/quote]
Now this made me laugh. A hotpocket isn’t going to cost $1.20 more because they aren’t buying them in bulk. It’s simply because they are reaping the profit to the fullest capabilities. They know the kids won’t buy hotpockets and bring them in, so why not raise a few dollars for the school in the process?

Yes, you do have a point though. The reason that Wal-Mart has such low prices is because they buy say 20 million cans of Monster for usually 60 cents. They can tell the company that produces Monster to sell the cans to them for 50 cents a can instead. Monster really has no choice, because they will still be making money and also selling 20 million cans. That is how Wal-Mart puts all of the little, family-owned businesses out of business.

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:48, topic:390508”]Convenience store (~10miles away)
Supermarket (~20-30 miles away)

The prices at the convenience store usually covers the cost for gas, but if you’re going to spend a good amount of time looking for ingredients and such, usually just going to a Supermarket will cover the cost of gas (if you shop correctly with COUPONS).

It may seem stupid that buying a hot pocket for a price much higher than just buying a box of them, but some places have no choice as they need to get some sort of profit.[/quote]
Exactly that, but JC once but a month of grocery’s for 5.20$, he is pro. <3

Read full topic

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Convenience store (~10miles away)
Supermarket (~20-30 miles away)

The prices at the convenience store usually covers the cost for gas, but if you’re going to spend a good amount of time looking for ingredients and such, usually just going to a Supermarket will cover the cost of gas (if you shop correctly with COUPONS).

It may seem stupid that buying a hot pocket for a price much higher than just buying a box of them, but some places have no choice as they need to get some sort of profit.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:46, topic:390508”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=486420.msg3565762#msg3565762 date=1302639667]

yeah talking economics here. The reason it cost’s much more in Cafes and Schools etc etc. is because you pay alot of VAT (value added tax). In supermarkets, stores you don’t pay as much VAT on your goods, because they brought it in bulk which costs far less to begin with, therefore they can afford to sell it cheaper. Schools and cafes don’t buy things in bulk which is much more expensive, therefore they have to make things a little more pricey to make up the lost profit.
As for runescape economics, i have no idea. L2P i guess.

What are you talking about? They charge more because we have no choice…

Retail mangement over MITB Geek sorry, JC im right your wrong. GOI

Lel, it’s called economics + common sense. Plus, l2grammar before posting any more comments. Ty.
[/quote]

nice argument, Quit the QQ and face the fact your proven wrong.

Lel, it’s called economics + common sense. Plus, l2grammar before posting any more comments. Ty.

l2grammar please. Ty[/quote]
You’re right, but wrong. VAT’s are a reason for the higher prices, but they’re insignificant. About buying in bulk and whatnot: you’re obviously correct to a certain extent because not buying in bulk ramps up the marginal cost quite a bit. You’ve got the idea, I guess.

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

It’s actually a mixture of both Jc. A “convenience store” (they’re all 7-Elevens where I live) charges you more not because you have no choice, they’re literally 50m from supermarkets in the city here. They charge more because they are more convenient (marginally, and they’re prices are more than marginally more expensive) they also charge more because supermarkets get cheaper goods in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:26, topic:390508”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=486420.msg3565030#msg3565030 date=1302571526]

I use coupons, and I still can’t do that.

You need to learn the art of couponing.

I know. I’ve been the one to buy groceries for my family for 8 years. I know how to work the system. I’m saying that even with coupons, where I live it’s nearly impossible to do that.

Nooooo, I am the King Coupon here, not you! Lol, where do you live and which are the grocery stores you go to?
[/quote]

Washington. Usually shop at Safeway/TOP Foods. I use in store coupons, and I have a lot of manufacturers email coupons, and coupons from the Sunday paper type things.[/quote]
Oh, Safeway sucks in terms of coupon usage and good sales. There are free items each week though, but not as many as Shoprite.

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:9, topic:390508”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=486420.msg3564747#msg3564747 date=1302557884]

The worst I’ve noticed this is on ski-trips. You go into any of the cafes on the mountain, you can probably expect to pay 4x the regular amount.

Oh yes, I was on the top of a glacier just 2 days ago, and they were charging 3.70 for a 500ml bottle of pepsi, whereas it’d normally be what, 0.70?

Same at my college too, 1.20 for lucozade, but 5 minutes into town in poundland it’s 2 for 1.00.
[/quote]
Europeans and their weird ass food/measuring system.[/quote]
Because measuring something in a “cup” is accurate - right?

Read full topic

I curse poundland! That’s where I got my partners pregnancy test and the woman behind the counter give me a huge lecture about getting girls pregnant! Never to this day will I enter there again.

Cheap though :)[/quote]
I’m assuming that’s similar to a dollar store in USA…

item.title: Convenience
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Actually, yes I did, the box come with two tests and we tested both hours apart from each other. When both come back positive I bought a more accurate one and it still come back the same.

She went to the doctors today (She’s visiting family up England, so it’s been hard for her to get an appointment) and the doc said she was hitting 9 weeks tomorrow. I don’t think I’ve ever worried so much in my life!

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:1, topic:390508”]Have you all ever realised how much we pay for convenience? For example, at my school they sell Hot Pockets in the lobby for $1.75 each. For a box of 12, it’s like 5-6 dollars. So if you go to a store and buy a box, each one costs between $0.42 and $0.50. But instead of going to the store, and getting a box for $6, with enough for about 2 weeks (one for breakfast every morning), they would rather pay the $1.75 because they don’t have to go anywhere.

I don’t know, just something I noticed.[/quote]
So… What you do is buy the box and cook them in the Faculty lounge, then sell them to student for $1 each.

profit???

When I was in High School, kids would sell Mt. Dew cans for $1 - $2 each. My friend made a couple hundred bucks a week.

Read full topic
